title: Republican Party (United States)
deleted: In October 2020 the [[V-Dem Institute]] found that the Republican party has becoming dramatically more illiberal over since 2000's with the party appearing to follow similar trajectory to parties such as [[Fidesz]], the [[BJP]], and the [[Justice and Development Party (Turkey)|AKP]]. And was "far more illiberal than almost all other governing parties in democracies," in 2018.<ref>https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2020/oct/26/republican-party-autocratic-hungary-turkey-study-trump</ref><ref>https://www.cnn.com/2020/10/26/world/republican-party-more-illiberal-study-intl/index.html</ref>

title: Republican Party (United States)
deleted: As of 2021, it is currently regarded as a party that prefers minority rule, despising [[Democracy|democratic]] majority rule through measures such as supporting the [[United States Electoral College|electoral college in the United States]] and defending the [[Filibuster in the United States Senate]]. Its main economic ideology has been strict [[Right-libertarianism]], opposing the growth of social [[welfare]] programs considered normal in most other western countries such as [[universal health care]]. Since the election of Donald Trump, its base has grown to white supremacists<ref>{{Cite web|last=Coaston|first=Jane|date=2018-07-09|title=Self-described Nazis and white supremacists are running as Republicans across the country. The GOP is terrified.|url=https://www.vox.com/2018/7/9/17525860/nazis-russell-walker-arthur-jones-republicans-illinois-north-carolina-virginia|access-date=2021-03-26|website=Vox|language=en}}</ref>.

title: Republican Party (United States)
added: In recent years pundits through podcasting and radio shows like [[Ben Shapiro]],and [[Steven Crowder]] have also gained fame with a consistently younger audience through outlets such as [[The Daily Wire]] [[Blaze Media|BlazeMedia]] etc.
